entry.title: Jim Dillard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jim Dillard (pictured) declined an offer to play in the National Football League?

entry.title: Danket, danket dem Herrn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 18th-century "Danket, danket dem Herrn", a thanksgiving round based on Psalm 106:1, has been described as one of the most widespread rounds in German?

entry.title: Alice Hayes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that British horse trainer Alice Hayes rode a zebra sidesaddle in the late 19th century?

entry.title: Indianapolis Community Food Access Coalition (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Indianapolis Community Food Access Coalition was created to resolve food deserts in the city of Indianapolis?

entry.title: Going Down Home with Daddy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Caldecott Honor–winning illustrations for Going Down Home with Daddy contain Adinkra symbols that represent various concepts in Ghanaian culture?

entry.title: Federico Gatti (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Federico Gatti went from playing in the Italian sixth division and doing menial jobs to joining Juventus and playing for the Italy national team?

entry.title: Touch the Sky Tour (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kanye West performed an additional Touch the Sky Tour date at the University of North Carolina Wilmington after coming third in a student survey?

entry.title: Hussars of Junín (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the decisive participation of a Peruvian cavalry unit in the Battle of Junín led Simón Bolívar to rename them the Hussars of Junín?
